Articles.Content:
Optimized Rocketry ANd General Exploration Systems
(Many thanks to @benjee10 for the name)

v1.0.0-beta-2 (6 February 2023)
Stockalike SDLVs for KSP

This mod adds parts you can use to create replicas of all sorts of Shuttle-Derived vehicles by myself  (@EStreetRockets) and @Invaderchaos. It is balanced like other stockalike mods such as BDB and Tantares, for a ~2.5x solar system. In the future we hope to add many more concepts!

DOWNLOADS
Github

 

DEVELOPMENT
BUG REPORTS
WIKI

Dependencies (included in download, check for latest versions!):

  • ModuleManager (4.1.4)
  • B9PartSwitch (2.17.0)
  • Community Resource Pack (1.4.2)
  • Simple Adjustable Fairings (1.12.0)

Installation:

Merge the GameData folder in the release .ZIP with the GameData folder in your KSP installation.
All of the dependencies come included with the mod.
The "ORANGES" folder, as well all dependencies, should appear alongside the "Squad" folder and any other mods.

Recommended Mods:

The following mods are strongly recommended for an enhanced gameplay experience:

  • Shuttle Orbiter Construction Kit (1.1.8) - Adds a fantastic Stockalike Space Shuttle Orbiter that fits with our External Tank!
  • CryoTanks (1.6.3) - This provides a set of patches provide fuel-switching features for the basic LF/O tanks as well as fuel tanks designed to contain cryogenic fuels.
  • Waterfall (0.9.0) - A cool way to create and drive engine effects more effectively. If you want cool engine plumes, get this mod.
  • Bluedog Design Bureau - A gigantic parts mod for creating stockalike replicas of Saturn, Apollo, Atlas V, Delta IV, and many more vehicles.

 

 

 

Licensing:

Spoiler

ORANGES by EStreetrockets and Invaderchaos is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.
We encourage you to make modifications to the content included in this mod and release it as your own, on the condition that we are credited where appropriate and are linked to the fork.
All source files for the mod, including uncompiled textures and models, are available upon request.

 

Edited March 16, 2023 by EStreetRockets

Congratulations on the release! These parts look awesome and it is great to finally have a worthy external tank to go with the shuttle!
Absolutley beautiful parts! Fantastic work!

Were you aware there was another mod called ORANGE (Oh Really, Another Name Generating Endeavour)?

5 minutes ago, linuxgurugamer said:

Were you aware there was another mod called ORANGE (Oh Really, Another Name Generating Endeavour)?

yes

Just to reiterate, we still got a lot planned for our first release. There’s a few things I’m currently working on. 
 

For the ET, I plan to add two more ET-derived tanks, an ET with an inline top and sts bottom, and an ET with an sts top and inline bottom. I also plan to add a bottom straight adapter with compatible raceway to make the ET compatible with generic mounts, an SLS-based engine mount derived from Benjee’s Artemis Construction Kit mod, and a delta blue tank paint job. 

I’m also doing some stuff with Photon Corp’s SRBs. Right now I’m working on some fixes, like general texture cleanup/compression reduction, adding emissive to the nozzles, and adding a switch for the avionics stripe. I also am working on parts for Athena III, a proposal that combines a 2.5 segment RSRM with the upper stages of Athena II. Fairing base is a placeholder in this image:

Beyond that I’m also working on some parts for SRB-X, Heimdall (SRB-X from Boldly Going), ASRM, and Ares I. These parts are a little more far out but stay tuned!
These look really nice!

The Hype-O-Meter is beyond comprehension 

Also Srb-X LETS GO!!!!!!!

Edited February 7, 2023 by Royalswissarmyknife

Edited February 7, 2023 by AtomicTech

This is coming together great! I'm already using this to abuse my powers.

I encourage you to dissect this thing. There are three major rocket families represented in this picture. I'm open to your guesses.

Only bug I've come across is a warning relating to B9 parts switch on the ET Inline, but it doesn't seem to cause any noticeable problems. I'll keep y'all posted.

BTW the payload capacity for the thing above is at least 172 tons to LKO.

Edited February 8, 2023 by Blufor878
Spec. Tac. U. Lar.
Delta Blue paintjob for the ET is now on Github!

With the new delta blue paintjob, I decided to make my take on a totally normal "Delta II":

Spoiler

It was able to put a 80t payload into a circular 500km orbit in KSRSS Reborn.

9 hours ago, Invaderchaos said:

With the new delta blue paintjob, I decided to make my take on a totally normal "Delta II":

  Hide contents

It was able to put a 80t payload into a circular 500km orbit in KSRSS Reborn.

This is what the Delta IV wishes it could be.
